project.name: Hera QA Platform
project.scope: Unified test orchestration, flaky test analytics

sections.title: Context & Role Alignment
sections.goal: Establish the interviewee’s role in the Hera QA Platform project and their understanding of security implications in QA processes.
sample_questions: Can you describe your responsibilities as QA Lead for Hera QA Platform?
How does the QA strategy integrate with the 'Safety First' company value?
Which parts of the Hera QA Platform architecture are you most concerned about from a security testing perspective?

sections.title: Risk-Based Testing Approach
sections.goal: Explore how risk-based testing is implemented and aligned with policy POL-QA-014.
sample_questions: Walk me through how you determine test prioritization using risk-based methods.
How do you ensure traceability from identified risks to executed test cases?
Can you give an example where a high-risk scenario was caught early due to your testing strategy?

sections.title: Traceability & Evidence
sections.goal: Assess how evidence is collected, stored, and audited for compliance.
sample_questions: What mechanisms do you use to link defects back to specific requirements or RFCs?
How do you handle evidence collection for security-related test cases?
Can you describe a time when an audit (e.g. AUD-24-Q2) required you to produce QA evidence?

sections.title: Integration with Other Systems
sections.goal: Understand how QA processes depend on and influence other subsystems like IAM, Observability, and DR.
sample_questions: How does Hera QA Platform integrate with Aegis IAM for secure test environments?
Do you leverage Nimbus Observability for flaky test analytics, and if so, how?
What’s the process for including disaster recovery scenarios (e.g., Titan DR) in testing?

sections.title: Security-Specific Test Scenarios
sections.goal: Dive into how security risks are incorporated into QA test plans.
sample_questions: How do you simulate mTLS failures from Poseidon Networking during QA runs?
What’s your approach to testing Policy-as-Code rules from Aegis IAM?
Have you ever had to adapt testing for a security patch with limited notice?

sections.title: Tradeoffs & Decision Making
sections.goal: Evaluate how the QA Lead makes tradeoffs between coverage, velocity, and security assurance.
sample_questions: Describe a time you chose to delay a release due to an unresolved high-severity defect.
How do you balance sustainable velocity with the need for exhaustive security testing?
What’s your process for deciding when to accept residual risk in a release candidate?

sections.title: Lessons Learned & Continuous Improvement
sections.goal: Identify how past incidents influenced changes in QA processes.
sample_questions: What lessons from the last 3 releases have influenced your current QA strategy?
How do you incorporate post-mortem findings into risk-based test selection?
Can you point to a specific runbook or RFC update that resulted from QA feedback?
